com.xhive.core.interfaces
Interface XhiveUserIf

public interface XhiveUserIf

Represents an X-Hive/DB User.

Users are defined on database level. A list (XhiveUserListIf) of all users can be obtained using XhiveDatabaseIf. Each user should have a unique name. Users can be owner of documents, libraries or indexes. A user can belong to multiple groups (XhiveGroupIf) . Groups can also be owner of documents, libraries or indexes.

(c) X-Hive Corporation B.V. (www.x-hive.com)

Since:
X-Hive/DB 1.0

Method Detail

getName

java.lang.String getName()
Retrieves the name of this user.

Returns:
The users name.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 1.1

addGroup

void addGroup(XhiveGroupIf group)
Add a group to the group list of this user.

Only the administrator or super user can add a group to a user. When a group with the same group name already belongs to the user, an exception is thrown.

Parameters:
group - the group.
Throws:
GROUP_ALREADY_EXISTS - when a group with the same group name already belongs to the user.
ACCESS_DENIED - when a user other than the administrator or super user tries to add the group.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 1.0

removeGroup

void removeGroup(XhiveGroupIf group)
Remove a group from the group list of this user.

Only the administrator or super user can remove a group from a user. When a group is removed from a user, the group itself is not deleted as other users can still belong to the same group. A XhiveGroupIf can only be deleted by using the function removeGroup from interface XhiveGroupListIf.

Parameters:
group - the group.
Throws:
ACCESS_DENIED - when a user other than the administrator or super user tries to remove the group.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 1.0

setPassword

void setPassword(java.lang.String oldPassword,
                 java.lang.String newPassword)
Set a new password for this user.

The supplied old password is encrypted and compared to the password stored with this user. If the old password does not match an exception is thrown.

Parameters:
oldPassword - the existing password. If the user making the change is the Administrator, and the user object does not represent the Administrator, the oldPassword may also be null to reset the user's password.
newPassword - the new password.
Throws:
XhiveException - with error PASSWORD_DOESNT_MATCH when the old password is not correct.
XhiveException - with error PASSWORD_ERROR when the new password is not a correct password.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 1.0

groups

java.util.Iterator<? extends XhiveGroupIf> groups()
Get an iterator for iterating through the groups that this user belongs to.

Returns:
A group iterator.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 1.1

isAdministrator

boolean isAdministrator()
Checks if a user is an administrator.
